result.execSummary:
The defendant Samantha C Biersack was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Penalty - Retail Theft (<=$500)], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bond amount posted in 15CM825 shall be applied to this case and balance shall be paid at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing December 1, 2015 and each 1st of the month thereafter until paid in full. There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample and make arrangements with the Washington County Sheriff's Department within 3 days to provide the sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samantha C Biersack

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned).

Def in person & by Atty Katherine Romanowich.  Atty Mark D. Bensen appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Court dismissed 15CM825 for read-in upon plea to this case.  Guilty plea entered. Court orders fine of $505.00 plus $200.00DNA surcharge, bond amount posted in 15CM825 shall be applied and balance to be paid at a rate of $25.00 per month commencing 12-1-15 or judgment shall be entered for nonpayment.  There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.  Court orders DNA sample arrangements to be made within 3 days at the WCSD.
Reset Hearing from Branch 4 on 10-28-15 to Branch 1 on 10-21-2015 at 01:15 pm for projected resolution with 15CM825.
Defendant's Authorization to Appear and Act
Victim does not request to be present for hearings

Atty Katherine Romanowich appearing for Def.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper for State.  Offer rec'd, anticipates resolution w/ Br 1 case; Defendant in outpatient program at Rogers;  Hearing scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety; shall take only prescribed medications; shall have no contact with Walmart Stores in Washington County; shall not possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Def in person & by Atty  Katherine Romanowich from State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Public defender will appoint counsel.  $1,000 Signature Bond w/conditions Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.  Hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 08:15 am.
